anime.description: To build Cosmo Babylonia, a space nation ruled by aristocrats, Crossbone Vanguard, the private army of Rohah`s, attacks Space Colony Frontier Side. When his peaceful homeland is destroyed, high school student Seabrook Arno pilots the latest model of Gundam, the Gundam F-91, and joins the resistance.

tag.name: military
tag.description: The military, also known as the armed forces, are forces authorized and legally entitled to use deadly force so as to support the interests of the state and its citizens. The task of the military is usually defined as defence of the state and its citizens and the prosecution of war against foreign powers. The military may also have additional functions within a society, including construction, emergency services, social ceremonies, and guarding critical areas. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: robot
tag.description: A robot is an automatically guided machine, able to do tasks on its own. Another common characteristic is that by its appearance or movements, a robot often conveys a sense that it has intent or agency of its own. Not to be confused with android (human-like robot).

tag.name: content indicators
tag.description: The content indicators branch is intended to be a less geographically specific tool than the `age rating` used by convention, for warning about things that might cause offence. Obviously there is still a degree of subjectivity involved, but hopefully it will prove useful for parents with delicate children, or children with delicate parents. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: collateral damage
tag.description: The usually action orientated anime does not only show large amounts of combat and weapon use, but also the incidental massive destruction of property, often due to the inability of the protagonists to aim properly. Example: Mecha duking it out in a densely populated urban area.

tag.name: future
tag.description: Anime that fall under the future category are the ones that have a society that could have originated from ours. In most cases it should go hand to hand with sci-fi since we expect the future to consist of advanced technology, however, in the case where it`s explicitly stated in the story that the anime takes place "x years into the future", the state of technology doesn`t matter as long as it`s long into the future. The anime can be set in an alternative universe not tied with our own, as long as it has a futuristic feel to it. This category sports quite a lot of anime, mostly stemming from SciFi, but not necessarily only from there.

tag.name: space
tag.description: The final frontier.

tag.name: human enhancement
tag.description: Human enhancement can take various forms: It can be something comparatively non-intrusive as a power-up drug, a form of machine implantation or cyberization (http://anidb.net/a4414 [SAC Solid State Society]), or outright - possibly atrocious - genetic manipulation (http://anidb.net/a361 [Ao no 6 Gou]). Plot-wise enhanced protagonists in anime usually have to pay a price for their enhancements, be it physical or mental.

tag.name: mecha
tag.description: Mecha in Japanese basically means mechanical things; everything from an electric whisk or a car to a spaceship or a robot. Here however we limit it to the more exotic things usually referred to as mecha anime: robots, whether controlled by a human or not, and their ilk. See Androids, Piloted Robots, Power Suits, Robot Helpers, Transforming Robots for a more specific classification.

tag.name: space travel
tag.description: Space Travel usually refers going to space or travelling there with or without a spacecraft. There are different forms of space travel like Interplanetary travel, Interstellar travel or Intergalactic travel. Since it isn`t possible to travel faster than light, most anime series involve some sort "sub-space travel mechanism" as a way to travel faster than light.

tag.name: piloted robot
tag.description: Piloted Robots are, as the name suggests, robots that cannot control themselves; they need to be steered from somewhere, this can be from a human sitting inside or a remote controlled option.

tag.name: shipboard
tag.description: Beam me up, Scotty! Space stations (think Death Star) also count. Basically, this category is to tell if the setting takes place onboard a spaceship in space. This category is not applicable if the spaceship lies on a planet and never actually gets into space.

tag.name: violence
tag.description: Violence is the use of physical force against oneself or another entity, compelling action against one`s will on pain of being hurt. Note: Refer to further guidance on http://wiki.anidb.net/w/Categories:Content_Indicators [the Wiki page] for how to apply tag weights for content indicators.

tag.name: space colony
tag.description: The human race (or possibly some alien race) has mastered space travel and founded at least one colony either in space, on a moon or another planet. This usually also includes colony-life episodes that not only show the technical staff of professionals (astronauts, scientists, etc.), but also their families (i.e. children).

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: science fiction
tag.description: Science fiction stories usually focus on how situations could be different in the future when we are more technologically advanced; due to either our own achievements or having met with other civilizations whom we have learned from.

tag.name: romance
tag.description: Romance describes a story that deals with love between two or more characters typically also having an optimistic ending. Romance is also a difficulty encountered when creating a harem.

tag.name: disaster
tag.description: A disaster is a large-scale situation that causes great loss of or damage or threat to life, health, property, society, or the environment, irrespective of its source or cause. Disasters have substantial, long-lasting negative repercussions, and great effort must be spent in order to undo or mitigate their effects.

tag.name: tragedy
tag.description: Tragedy is a form of drama characterized by seriousness and dignity, usually involving a conflict between a character and some higher power, such as the law, the gods, fate, or society.

tag.name: genetic modification
tag.description: Story-wise, genetic modification is usually centred on humans, probably the most subtle and creepy way of messing with mankind. Playing with the fear of the unknown, genetically altered humans are technically a new species, that may not only surpass but actually replace unaltered humans. The level of modification will vary from subtle changes in "look" (e.g. super-human beauty), to mental enhancements (PSI powers), to more or less atrocious adaptations to extreme environments (breath under water, radiation resistance). Note that changes in Aliens would be difficult to pinpoint, after all they are alien.

tag.name: war
tag.description: War is a phenomenon of organized violent conflict, typified by extreme aggression, societal disruption and adaptation, and high mortality. The objective of warfare differs in accord with a group`s role in a conflict: The goals of offensive warfare are typically the submission, assimilation or destruction of another group, while the goals of defensive warfare are simply the repulsion of the offensive force and, often, survival itself. Relative to each other, combatants in warfare are called enemies. The terms military, militant, and militarism each refer to fundamental aspects of war, i.e. the organized group, the combative individual, and the supportive ethos (respectively). Source: wiki

tag.name: important haircut
tag.description: When a character cuts off his or her hair, it often symbolizes a rite of passage or bout of character growth. A princess striking out on an adventure, or a new recruit at boot camp, for instance. Hair is something that takes time and effort to grow, so parting with it voluntarily can be a powerful act. This is particularly a big deal when women get haircuts. Yet in fiction, even an accidental hair slicing can leave a character with a surprisingly even cut. In many religions (Western Christianity, Ancient Egyptian religion, and others) priests and/or monks cut/shave their hair. Roman Catholic nuns also tend to cut and mantain their hair short under their veils when they enter the nunneries. The cutting of one`s own hair is also a part of Buddhist mythology, specifically something done by Siddhartha himself early on in his path to enlightenment, so anime examples might draw from this as an allusion. There are also some cultures, including Native American and many Asians, where a person would cut his or her hair as an act of grief, disgrace, or even rebellion. In the Confucian tradition, hair (like the rest of your body) is considered a gift from your parents and may not be damaged without a very good reason. Furthermore, prisoners and psychiatric patients commonly have their heads shaved, often to prevent the spread of lice, but sometimes also as a demeaning measure. Source: TVTRope

tag.name: Universal Century
tag.description: Refers to the Universal Century timeline in Gundam anime. Gundam anime with this tag all belong in the same universe.

tag.name: kids in war
tag.description: When minors participate in armed conflict.

tag.name: space battles
tag.description: There are space battles in this anime. Usually between Earth forces and some alien invader, but ship to ship skirmishes in deep space are just as common.

tag.name: real robot
tag.description: A smaller form of mecha with no special abilities. They are mostly used by deploying them in battle just like modern tanks. They can be mass produced and their pilots (usually military officers or soldiers) are (mostly) interchangeable. Tanks are often a threat to them and they are more easily destroyed than their bigger counterparts.

tag.name: fast-paced
tag.description: Hold onto your hats, this anime`s storyline is relentless. The characters don`t get time to take a breath as events keep both them and the viewer on a roller coaster ride of revelation and excitement! Hopefully it all makes sense...

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

tag.name: multi-anime projects
tag.description: Many anime are created as part of larger projects encompassing many shows without direct relation to one another. Normally, there is a specific idea in mind: for example, the http://anidb.net/t4859 [Young Animator Training Project] aims to stimulate the on-the-job training of next-generation professionals of the anime industry, whereas the http://anidb.net/t3763 [World Masterpiece Theatre] aims to animate classical stories from all over the world.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: speculative fiction
tag.description: Speculative fiction is an umbrella genre encompassing fiction with certain elements that do not exist in the real world, often in the context of supernatural, futuristic or other imaginative themes. This includes, but is not limited to, science fiction, fantasy, superhero fiction, horror, utopian and dystopian fiction, fairytale fantasy, supernatural fiction, as well as combinations thereof. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Super Robot Wars
tag.description: Super Robot Wars is a series of tactical role-playing video games produced by Banpresto. The main feature of the franchise is having a story that crosses over several popular mecha anime, manga and video games, allowing characters and mecha from different titles to team up or battle one another. Due to the nature of crossover games and licensing involved, only a few games have been released outside Japan, and in English; early English-language games only feature Banpresto`s original characters and mecha, and a flagship installment were to never be released until 2016, with the English release of Super Robot Wars V in Southeast Asian countries. The franchise celebrated its 25th anniversary in 2016. Source: Wikipedia

character.name: F91 Gundam F91
character.description: This prototype machine, created by the military research institute SNRI, is the latest product of the Federation Forces` miniaturized mobile suit development program. The F91`s capabilities exceed those of any contemporary mobile suit, but its full potential can only be expressed with a Newtype pilot at the controls. In its high-performance mode, the F91`s face mask opens to help cool the bio-computer installed in its head, ventilator fins are deployed from its shoulders, and it can dissipate excess heat via the Metal Peel-off Effect. Thanks to its high generator output the F91 can drive multiple beam weapons, including a beam rifle, a beam shield, and a pair of powerful Variable-Speed Beam Rifle (VSBR) units. Another new technology incorporated in the Gundam F91 was the bio-computer system developed by Doctor Monica Arno. This system acted as a sort of "reversed" psycommu system, relaying information directly to the pilot`s mind rather than vice versa. The bio-computer, however, could be used by normal pilots, and it gave the pilot many advantages by directly providing him with tactical and sensor data, piloting suggestions, and so on. Thus, the bio-computer allowed the pilot to react more quickly and decisively to any battle situation, and it also made a novice pilot`s job easier in terms of adapting to the new mobile suit. The F91 prototype, originally manufactured by SNRI in UC 0116, was slowly upgraded and modified over the next several years. Its final assembly, which incorporated the bio-computer system, was cut short when the Crossbone Vanguard force began conquering the Frontier Side area in March UC 0123. The F91`s parts were stowed aboard the Federation Forces` training ship Space Ark, and during an escape to the Frontier I colony, the Space Ark crew rescued a group of civilian students who were also fleeing. Since the ship`s complement was made up of trainees - and a skeleton crew, at that - a pilot was needed to pilot the F91 when it was completed. Seabook Arno, one of the rescued civilians, was selected for the job, based on his rather shaky credentials of being an engineering student and the son of bio-computer engineer Doctor Arno. Although reluctant to become a soldier, Seabook soon found himself performing his duties well, adapting to the F91 easily and scoring three enemy MS kills on his first sortie. The Gundam F91 would perform superbly during the conflict, and its abilities would soon have another surprise in store for Seabook. Being a very high-performance unit, the F91`s weapons and systems generated a tremendous amount of heat. This heat was normally dissipated through a seat of radiator fins built into the mobile suit`s shoulders; however, excessive amounts of heat would sometimes still remain throughout the mobile suit`s body. Another method of getting rid of this heat was by "shedding" the heated outermost layer of the Gundam`s armour; this had the rather dramatic effect of creating "after-images" of the mobile suit while it was moving. While confronting Crossbone Vanguard leader Carozzo Ronah`s deadly XMA-01 Rafflesia mobile armor, Seabook would find this ability useful in tricking his enemy into attacking targets that were not where they appeared to be.

character.name: Rafflesia
character.description: This huge mobile armour is one of the products of Iron Mask`s secret Rafflesia Project. The Rafflesia resembles a giant flower, whose main body houses a battery of powerful beam cannons capable of destroying an Earth Federation battleship with one salvo, and whose five petals contain dozens of tentacular rods for grappling enemy mobile suits. The mobile armour is also equipped with an I-field generator whose barrier deflects all enemy beam weapons. Iron Mask controls the Rafflesia via mental commands, which are relayed through optical fibers connected to his distinctive helmet. The Rafflesia, being Carozzo`s personal unit, was controlled by his brainwaves via a "neo-psycommu" system - an advancement on the classic psycommu technology. This system, which was composed of receptors in Iron Mask`s helmet connected to the mobile armour via a great number of fiber optic cables, allowed Carozzo to completely control all aspects of his machine without the use of manual controls. Stored aboard the flagship Zamouth Gar, the Rafflesia was only deployed once near the end of the initial conflicts during the Crossbone Vanguard invasion of March UC 0123. Carozzo took his mobile armour into battle to kill his rebellious daughter Berah Ronah, who was trying to stop his plan to kill all humans living on Earth with his Bug weapons. Though his Rafflesia would deliver serious damage to Berah`s XM-07 Vigna Ghina, the mighty mobile armour would soon fall to Seabook Arno, who used some ingenious tricks taking advantage of the http://anidb.net/ch1726 [Gundam F91`s] abilities to cause the Rafflesia to destroy itself.

character.name: Vigna Ghina
character.description: The Vigna Ghina is a prototype command mobile suit that is assigned to Cecily Fairchild after she rejoins the Ronah family. Based on the Crossbone Vanguard`s Berga series, this new model is equipped with a set of fin nozzles which are connected directly to its generator, yielding even greater performance. With its high mobility and power output, the Vigna Ghina is the most advanced mobile suit yet developed by the Crossbone Vanguard. When Cecily defects to the Earth Federation Forces during the Crossbone Vanguard invasion of UC 0123, her Vigna Ghina is also given a powerful beam launcher similar to that used by the http://anidb.net/ch1726 [Gundam F91], capable of delivering a wider and more damaging beam blast than a standard beam rifle. Berah`s Vigna Ghina was destroyed in a battle against the mobile armor http://anidb.net/ch1728 [XMA-01 Rafflesia], piloted by her father, Carozzo Ronah.

character.name: Dahgi Iris
character.description: This command mobile suit is used by leaders of Crossbone Vanguard reconnaissance teams. The Dahgi Iris is equipped with a battery of cameras and precision sensors, and its information-processing capabilities allow it to search as wide an area as five or six ordinary mobile suits. Since the energy emissions of a beam shield might interfere with its delicate sensors and electronics, the Dahgi Iris carries a traditional shield, and uses its surplus energy to generate additional thrust. One Dahgi Iris unit was piloted by Annamarie Bourget, who later defected to the Earth Federation Forces during the Crossbone Vanguard invasion of UC 0123. Annamarie`s Dahgi Iris was then repainted into an off-yellow color to more easily distinguish it from its loyal Crossbone counterparts.

character.name: Dahgi Iris
character.description: Repaint to Earth Federation Forces colors.

character.name: Zamouth Garr
character.description: This is the flagship of the Crossbone Vanguard fleet, which also serves as Iron Mask`s base of operations. Like all Crossbone Vanguard vessels, the Zamouth Garr has a retractable bridge which slides into its hull for extra protection during battle. The ship itself can separate into four sections - prow, stern, and two catapult decks. The prow section deploys the automated anti-personnel weapons known as Bugs, and the stern section contains the mobile armor http://anidb.net/ch1728 [Rafflesia].

character.name: Zamouth Giri
character.description: This class of battleship is used to command the Crossbone Vanguard`s space fleets. While the Zamouth Giri has great firepower and high power output, its mobile suit capacity is relatively modest, and it has only a single storage hangar and catapult.

character.name: Zamouth Gess
character.description: This class of cruiser makes up the backbone of the Crossbone Vanguard space fleet. Though its firepower is inferior to that of the Zamouth Giri, the Zamouth Gess has powerful engines and an extended cruising range, and it`s equipped with both forward and rear mobile suit decks.

character.name: Zamouth Nahda
character.description: This class of destroyer is the smallest vessel in the Crossbone Vanguard space fleet, only a third of the size of the flagship Zamouth Garr. Due to its small size, the Zamouth Nahda has no internal hangars or catapults, and carries its mobile suits on external storage platforms. As with other Crossbone Vanguard ships, its bridge can retract into its hull for protection, and can also detach to become an emergency escape craft.

character.name: Crossbone Vanguard
character.description: A fighting force organized by the http://anidb.net/ch1753 [Ronah family] in U.C. 0106, drawing on the skilled personnel of the http://anidb.net/ch1751 [Buch Concern] and its vocational training school. This private army is meant to serve as an advance guard, or vanguard, for the nation of http://anidb.net/ch1752 [Cosmo Babylonia]. Originally founded by Meitzer Ronah, the Crossbone Vanguard is eventually placed under the command of the mysterious Iron Mask. After years of preparation, the Crossbone Vanguard enters combat with an assault on the space colony Frontier I in U.C. 0123. This highly motivated elite force far surpasses the Earth Federation Forces in terms of training and tactical skill, and its advanced mobile suits also outperform the Federation`s antiquated machines.

character.name: Buch Aerodynamics
character.description: Mobile suit manufacturer, subdivision of Buch Concern.

character.name: Buch Concern
character.description: The Ronah family`s business empire, established in U.C. 0055. Its subdivisions include the Buch Junk salvage company, the mobile suit manufacturer http://anidb.net/ch1740 [Buch Aerodynamics], and a vocational training school which later provides the basis for the private army known as the http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard].

character.name: Cosmo Babylonia
character.description: A new nation established by the http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard], made up of the captured space colonies of the Frontier Side. Under the leadership of the Ronah family, Cosmo Babylonia is dedicated to the principles of aristocracy and noblesse oblige. Cosmo Babylonia soon establishes an alliance with the Jupiter Fleet, allowing it to stave off Earth Federation interference with the threat of an energy embargo.

character.name: Meika Ronah
character.description: The founders of the http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard] and http://anidb.net/ch1752 [Cosmo Babylonia], whose original family name was Buch. Having made a fortune in the salvage business, family patriarch Scharnhorst Buch purchased the Ronah name in U.C. 0068 to suit his aristocratic ambitions. For a family that believed itself truly superior to the common masses who polluted the Earth sphere, this act seemed like a suitable way to distinguish itself. In addition to the business empire known as the http://anidb.net/ch1751 [Buch Concern], the Ronah family has also held important positions in the Earth Federation Assembly and the Colony Public Corporation, allowing it to advance its own grand plans. In U.C. 0123, the Ronah family uses its private army, the http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard], to seize the Frontier Side and found the nation of http://anidb.net/ch1752 [Cosmo Babylonia].

character.name: Berga Dalas
character.description: This is the first in a series of command mobile suits developed by the http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard]. The Berga Dalas is larger and more powerful than the Den`an series, and six shelf nozzles are attached to its backpack for increased mobility. Its backpack also houses a beam flag emitter, which is used to guide the other pilots in the commander`s squadron. While most of the http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard`s] squadron commanders use the newer Berga Giros, Dorel Ronah still pilots this earlier model into battle.

character.name: Black Vanguard
character.description: An elite http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard] squadron commanded by Lieutenant Zabine Chareux. The squadron`s mobile suits use a distinctive black-and-purple color scheme.

character.name: Berga Giros
character.description: This command mobile suit is used exclusively by http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard] squadron leaders like Zabine Chareux of the elite http://anidb.net/ch1763 [Black Vanguard] force. Based on the http://anidb.net/ch1758 [Berga Dalas], this newer model features improved sensor and thruster systems, and an extra pair of shelf nozzles are attached to its backpack. While its armament is essentially identical to that of its predecessor, the Berga Giros is equipped with a hand-held shot lancer that can be put aside during combat, unlike the fixed version used by the http://anidb.net/ch1758 [Berga Dalas].

character.name: Berga Giros
character.description: Berga Giros in Zabine Chareux colors.

character.name: Ebirhu S
character.description: The smallest of the http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard] mobile suits, this reconnaissance model often enters the battlefield ahead of the main force to scout out enemy defenses. The Ebirhu S is equipped with numerous cameras and sensors, and a shoulder-mounted recon pod which can be launched to gather data. It`s also capable of engaging in combat thanks to the weapons built into its left arm, which include a shoulder-mounted grenade rack, a shot lancer, a battery of heavy machine guns, and a unique shot claw device.

character.name: Ebirhu S
character.description: Ebirhu-S in http://anidb.net/ch1763 [Black Vanguard] squadron colors.

character.name: Den`an Gei
character.description: This is the second machine in the Den`an series, which together with the Den`an Zon makes up the bulk of the http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard] mobile suit forces. The Den`an Gei is a fighter type which uses its superior mobility to perform high-speed hit and run attacks. Unlike most http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard] mobile suits, which are equipped with shot lancers for close-range combat, the Den`an Gei is armed with a traditional beam rifle and a shoulder-mounted grenade rack.

character.name: Den`an Gei
character.description: Den`an Gei in http://anidb.net/ch1763 [Black Vanguard] squadron colors.

character.name: Den`an Zon
character.description: The Den`an Zon is the first of the miniaturized mobile suits produced by the http://anidb.net/ch1738 [Crossbone Vanguard]. Based on the experimental Dessa type developed by the civilian company http://anidb.net/ch1740 [Buch Aerodynamics], this compact machine boasts superb performance and introduces new technologies such as the beam shield and the goggle-style hybrid dual sensor. Designed for close-range combat, the Den`an Zon is armed with a shot lancer that can penetrate enemy armor without triggering a devastating reactor explosion.

character.name: Den`an Zon
character.description: Den`an Zon in http://anidb.net/ch1763 [Black Vanguard] squadron colors.

character.name: Bug
character.description: This automated anti-personnel weapon is another product of Iron Mask`s secret Rafflesia Project. The Bugs were created to purge the Earth Sphere of its surplus population, exterminating human beings while causing minimal damage to buildings and natural environments. These machines are capable of detecting humans by their respiration, body heat, or motion, and can attack their prey inside confined spaces like buildings and emergency shelters by deploying 60-centimeter-wide http://anidb.net/ch1773 [Child Bugs]. While their primary purpose is to target civilians, Bugs are also capable of destroying mobile suits, tanks, and other fighting vehicles.

character.name: Child Bug
character.description: Deployed by http://anidb.net/ch1772 [Bugs] to reach humans in places 3 meter long http://anidb.net/ch1772 [Bugs] are not able to access.

character.name: Earth Federation
character.description: The unified world government that launched the space settlement program and now rules over both Earth and the space colonies. Its main decision-making body is the Earth Federation Assembly, which meets occasionally to pass new legislation. Though not as cruel and aggressive as the Principality of Zeon`s leaders, the bureaucrats who rule over the Earth Federation are corrupt, weak-willed, and insensitive to the space colonists` desire for independence. After the One Year War, the Federation decides to concentrate its energies on reconstructing Earth instead of the space colonies, further increasing political tensions.

character.name: Earth Federation Forces
character.description: The military arm of the Earth Federation. The Federation Forces are divided into several branches, including land, sea, air, and space forces. Until mass production of the RGM-79 GM begins in the final weeks of the One Year War, the Federation Forces are forced to battle the Principality of Zeon`s mobile suits using conventional tanks, planes, and space fighters. Even in the postwar years, the Federation Forces are usually inferior to their opponents in terms of skill, morale, and equipment.

character.name: Seabook Arno
character.description: An engineering student at the Frontier IV space colony, who flees with his sister and friends when the colony is attacked by the Crossbone Vanguard. At the nearby Frontier I colony, Seabook and company find refuge aboard the Federation Forces training ship Space Ark. Seabook is forced to defend the ship by piloting the prototype F91 Gundam, and his natural talent as a mobile suit pilot leads the crew to speculate that the young man is one of the Newtypes of legend. Ironically, the F91`s advanced bio-computer was designed by Seabook`s mother, whom he bitterly resents for abandoning their family to concentrate on her research work. Source: Official Site

character.name: Cecily Fairchild
character.description: This young woman is one of Seabook`s high school classmates at Frontier IV. Cecily was born Berah Ronah, a child of the aristocratic family that leads the Crossbone Vanguard, but ten years ago she and her mother fled the Ronah family and began a new life. Now her mother has disappeared again, leaving Cecily in the care of her stepfather Theo Fairchild. When the Crossbone Vanguard seize control of Frontier IV, Cecily rejoins the Ronah family and reluctantly agrees to become a symbol of their newly established nation of Cosmo Babylonia. Source: Official Site

character.name: Berah Ronah
character.description: This young woman is one of Seabook`s high school classmates at Frontier IV. Cecily was born Berah Ronah, a child of the aristocratic family that leads the Crossbone Vanguard, but ten years ago she and her mother fled the Ronah family and began a new life. Now her mother has disappeared again, leaving Cecily in the care of her stepfather Theo Fairchild. When the Crossbone Vanguard seize control of Frontier IV, Cecily rejoins the Ronah family and reluctantly agrees to become a symbol of their newly established nation of Cosmo Babylonia. Source: Official Site

character.name: Rees Arno
character.description: Seabook`s little sister is an elementary school student at the Frontier IV space colony. Rees flees the colony along with her brother and finds refuge aboard the training ship Space Ark, where she immediately makes herself useful by delivering food to the ship`s overworked crew. Although gentle and compassionate by nature, Rees shows stubborn determination when she`s sticking up for her brother or scolding her timid "boyfriend" Bertuo Rodriguez. Source: Official Site

character.name: Leslie Arno
character.description: Seabook`s and Rees` father, who abandoned his career as a metals researcher rather than see his work used for military purposes, and now supports his children as a construction worker at Frontier IV`s spaceport. When the colony is attacked by the Crossbone Vanguard, Leslie helps Seabook and friends escape in a space boat, but he himself is left behind at Frontier IV. Source: Official Site

character.name: Monica Arno
character.description: Seabook`s and Rees` mother is an engineer in the employ of the military research institute SNRI, and the designer of the bio-computer installed in the prototype F91 Gundam. Monica has essentially separated from her family in order to devote herself to her research work, and her children have deeply mixed feelings towards their absent mother. Source: Official Site

character.name: Theo Fairchild
character.description: Cecily`s stepfather, who manages a bakery at the Frontier IV space colony. Though he helped Cecily and her mother escape the Ronah family a decade earlier, Theo has now become an agent of the Ronahs, and when the Crossbone Vanguard attack the colony he forces Cecily to rejoin her aristocratic family at gunpoint. Source: Official Site

character.name: Nadia Ronah
character.description: Cecily`s mother is the daughter of Meitza Ronah, the leader of the Crossbone Vanguard. Ten years ago Nadia eloped with Theo Fairchild and fled the Ronah family, eventually taking up residence at the Frontier IV space colony. Three years ago, Nadia once again disappeared in order to escape detection by the Ronah family, this time leaving her daughter in the care of her stepfather Theo. Source: Official Site

character.name: Cosmo Eigesse
character.description: A former colonel in the Earth Federation Forces, who becomes the leader of the civilian resistance movement after the Crossbone Vanguard attack the Frontier Side. Cosmo decides to turn the training ship Space Ark into the resistance headquarters, and the arrogant attitude he displays towards soldiers and civilians alike soon earns him the enmity of Seabook and the Space Ark crew. Source: Official Site

character.name: Leahlee Edaberry
character.description: A junior Federation Forces officer, who becomes acting captain of the training ship Space Ark once all the vessel`s senior officers leave to fight the Crossbone Vanguard. It`s Leahlee who gives the F91 Gundam its name, as an homage to the legendary mobile suits of years past. Her top priority is to get the Space Ark, and its cargo of civilian refugees, safely out of the Frontier I space colony before they can be dragged into the destructive conflict. Source: Official Site

character.name: Berghito Pirieau
character.description: A Federation Forces cadet assigned to the training ship Space Ark, who is now the closest thing the ship has to a regular mobile suit pilot. Though given to sarcastic wisecracks, Birgit is actually kindly and good-natured, and he provides Seabook with support and encouragement when the young civilian is pressed into duty as a substitute pilot. Source: Official Site

character.name: Meitza Ronah
character.description: The patriarch of the Ronah family and the spiritual leader of the Crossbone Vanguard. Meitza has worked for decades to realize his family`s dream of a nation dedicated to the principles of "Cosmo Aristocracy." Having driven away his daughter Nadia with his ideological zeal, Meitza now hopes to replace her with his granddaughter Cecily, whom he intends to turn into a living symbol of his newly founded Cosmo Babylonia. Source: Official Site

character.name: Korozo Ronah
character.description: The mysterious commander of the Crossbone Vanguard forces. Iron Mask is actually Cecily`s father Korozo, a brilliant scientist who married into the Ronah family but was then abandoned by his wife Nadia. Hiding his shame and humiliation behind a metal mask, Korozo turned himself into an artificially enhanced cyber-Newtype in order to help realize the ambitions of his father-in-law Meitza Ronah. As Iron Mask, he possesses superhuman strength and mental powers, and a ruthless dedication to the Crossbone Vanguard`s ideals. Source: Official Site

character.name: Dorel Ronah
character.description: Cecily`s half-brother, who is now the commander of a Crossbone Vanguard mobile suit squadron. Though not a blood relation to the Ronah family, Dorel was adopted into the family along with his father Korozo, and he has earned his current position through his courage and piloting skills. Dorel regards the cunning Zabine Chareux as his chief rival, and his competitiveness sometimes leads him to take foolish risks in battle. Source: Official Site

character.name: Zabine Chareux
character.description: The commander of the Crossbone Vanguard`s elite Black Vanguard squadron. Zabine is a superb pilot and a clever tactician, and his rapid rise through the ranks has led many old-timers to resent him as an upstart. Though loyal to the Crossbone Vanguard, Zabine harbors secret ambitions of his own, and when he is assigned to train and protect Cecily he sees this as a perfect opportunity to work his way closer to the Ronah family. Source: Official Site

character.name: Annamarie Brougia
character.description: A young mobile suit pilot who commands one of the Crossbone Vanguard`s reconnaissance teams. Annamarie is devoted to her mentor Zabine Chareux, but she is jealous of the attention he gives to Cecily, and ultimately decides to get even by defecting to the Federation Forces. Source: Official Site

character.name: Gilais Kreuger
character.description: Iron Mask`s top aide, who serves as captain of the Crossbone Vanguard flagship Zamouth Garr. Gilais is fanatically loyal to his master, rather than to the Crossbone Vanguard as a whole, and he carries out Iron Mask`s genocidal orders without mercy or hesitation. Source: Official Site
